title: WishMint AI: Eliminate mobile horizontal overflow and right-side black space

requirements.summary: Replace the viewport meta tag to use device-width, initial-scale=1, and viewport-fit=cover.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/index.html` contains the viewport meta tag exactly as provided by the user.
The previous `initial-scale=1.0` viewport meta tag is removed/replaced (no duplicate viewport tags).

file_operations.description: Replace the existing viewport meta tag with exactly: `<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, viewport-fit=cover" />`, ensuring no duplicate viewport tags remain.

requirements.summary: Add a global CSS baseline to prevent mobile horizontal scrolling and ensure root wrapper sizing.
acceptanceCriteria: At mobile widths (360px / 390px / 414px), the page does not allow horizontal scrolling (no sideways pan).
#root expands full width and at least the viewport height on mobile.

file_operations.description: Add global overflow prevention styles: apply `width: 100%`, `margin: 0`, and `overflow-x: hidden` to `html, body`; ensure `#root` has `width: 100%` and `min-height: 100vh`. Also add a safe baseline for media elements (e.g., images/canvas/svg) to not exceed container width to reduce accidental overflow.

requirements.summary: Ensure the dark premium gradient background covers the full viewport on mobile without creating overflow.
acceptanceCriteria: On mobile, there is no unstyled/black empty band on the right side; the background visually covers the entire viewport.
No new horizontal overflow is introduced by `100vw` usage (if used, it is handled safely).
The existing dark premium gradient design language remains consistent (no visual theme change away from the current dark/neon look).

file_operations.description: Adjust the top-level App wrapper to be a single full-width, mobile-safe container (e.g., ensure `w-full` and `min-h-[100dvh]`/`min-h-screen`) and apply/host the existing dark/neon gradient background coverage consistently across the viewport. Ensure the chosen approach does not reintroduce horizontal overflow (avoid unsafe `100vw` or compensate if required).

If needed to support full-viewport background coverage, add minimal global styles for `body` / `#root` to keep the existing dark/neon gradient language consistent across the full viewport while preserving the current theme (no re-theming).

requirements.summary: Remove fixed-width constraints in layout/sections and replace with responsive mobile-first sizing to prevent overflow.
acceptanceCriteria: No fixed-width Tailwind classes (e.g., `w-[400px]`, `w-[420px]`, `w-[450px]`) remain on main layout wrappers/sections that participate in the mobile layout flow.
Primary sections (Hero, Generator, Templates, Pricing, Outputs, etc.) render with full-width behavior on 360px/390px/414px without clipping or right-side empty space.

file_operations.description: Audit Hero layout containers and decorative layers for any fixed-width constraints or sizing patterns that can exceed the viewport; replace with mobile-first responsive patterns (`w-full`, responsive `max-w-*`, `mx-auto`, and appropriate `px-*`) while keeping existing visuals and interactions unchanged.

Audit Generator section wrappers/cards/grids for any non-responsive width constraints that can force overflow; replace with responsive `w-full` + sane `max-w-*` + padding patterns so the form and card never exceed the viewport on mobile.

Audit Templates grid and preview card for overflow-causing sizing (including template preview containers); ensure responsive `w-full` behavior and safe padding so the grid/preview does not push beyond the viewport on small screens.

Audit Output section card grid and action button row for mobile sizing; ensure responsive wrapping and container widths that cannot exceed the viewport (e.g., ensure long text and button groups wrap without forcing horizontal scroll).

Audit Pricing section cards/table wrapper for any fixed widths or padding patterns that can exceed mobile viewport; ensure responsive container sizing and safe horizontal padding so the section stays within bounds at 360px/390px/414px.

requirements.summary: Find and fix the specific element(s) causing right-side overflow so no DOM node exceeds viewport width on mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: At 360px/390px/414px, the page fully fits the screen with NO black area on the right side.
There is no horizontal scrollbar and no content is cut off on the left/right edges.
Existing interactions and feature behavior are unchanged (only layout/overflow fixes).

file_operations.description: Adjust the confetti DOM injection styling so generated fixed-position pieces cannot extend the document width (e.g., clamp horizontal positioning and/or center via translate) while preserving the existing confetti behavior and visuals.

Add a targeted overflow-safety baseline to reduce risk of any single oversized element causing horizontal scroll (e.g., ensure common media elements and long text containers can shrink/wrap within the viewport) without altering existing UI behavior.
